title: Marius Bruat
text:
Marius Bruat (27 June 1930 – 1 January 2020) was a French <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
Biography.
Bruat was recruited in 1950 to <a href="FC%20Sochaux-Montb%C3%A9liard">FC Sochaux-Montbéliard</a>. He played for the <a href="France%20national%20football%20team">French national team</a> on 17 December 1953 in a <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">World Cup</a> qualifying match against <a href="Luxembourg%20national%20football%20team">Luxembourg</a>.
In 1957, <a href="Lef%C3%A8vre-Utile">Lefèvre-Utile</a> released a photo album of "French Football Champions", which featured Bruat.
In 1964, he was a finalist in the <a href="Coupe%20de%20la%20Ligue">Coupe de la Ligue</a> as coach of <a href="RC%20Strasbourg%20Alsace">RC Strasbourg Alsace</a>. He served as head coach of <a href="SR%20Colmar">SR Colmar</a> from 1976 to 1978, and then AS Sundhoffen from 1978 to 1983.
Marius Bruat died on 1 January 2020, at the age of 89.
